com.github.cooperroalson.untitled_thinggy_thingg.core.gamestates

Interface GameState

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    BackgroundAnimationGameState, UIGameState, WorldGameState

    public interface GameState
    An interface which represents the current state of the game. This interface handles the drawing of the screen, event handling, and game updates. The GameManager stores the current GameState

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Drawable> draw()
      Compiles a list of Drawables, which will be drawn to the screen by the WindowManager.
      void handleMouseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
      Dispatches MouseEvents
      default void registerActionMap()
      Registers the Actions associated with this GameState.
      default javax.swing.ComponentInputMap registerKeyBindings(javax.swing.JComponent component)
      Registers/activates the current keybindings by adding them to the JPanel's InputMap.
      void update()
      Updates the game.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        java.util.List<Drawable> draw()
        Compiles a list of Drawables, which will be drawn to the screen by the WindowManager.
        Returns:
        A List of Drawables

      • registerKeyBindings

        default javax.swing.ComponentInputMap registerKeyBindings(javax.swing.JComponent component)
        Registers/activates the current keybindings by adding them to the JPanel's InputMap.
        Parameters:
        component - The GamePanel
        Returns:
        An input map with all the key mappings

      • registerActionMap

        default void registerActionMap()
        Registers the Actions associated with this GameState. This should only occur once per class (you should probably use a static boolean field to keep track of this).

      • update

        void update()
        Updates the game.

      • handleMouseEvent

        void handleMouseEvent(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
        Dispatches MouseEvents
        Parameters:
        e - The MouseEvent to handle
